intro: Dysoxylum rubrocostatum, commonly known as the red-costed dysoxylum, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive reddish-brown bark that has a rugged, costate texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
